SEARCH

Class javaproject

java.lang.Object
javaproject
public class javaproject extends Object
This class javaproject provides command-line interference for the user for operations like: Statistical Information about an array, matrix operations, text encryption/decryption, and a Tic-tac-toe game

    • getPlayerPosition

      public static int getPlayerPosition(String player, char[][] gameBoard)
      Prompts the specified player to enter their placement on the game board. Validates the input to ensure it's an integer between 1 and 9, and checks if the position is already taken.
      Parameters:
      player - The name of the player (e.g., "Player 1" or "Player 2").
      gameBoard - The current state of the game board represented as a 2D character array.
      Returns:
      The validated position chosen by the player.
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException - If the input is not an integer.

    • printGameBoard

      public static void printGameBoard(char[][] gameBoard)
      Prints the current state of the game board to the console.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - The current state of the game board represented as a 2D character array.

    • placePiece

      public static void placePiece(char[][] gameBoard, int pos, String user)
      Places a player's symbol on the game board at the specified position.
      Parameters:
      gameBoard - The current state of the game board represented as a 2D character array.
      pos - The position on the board where the player wants to place their symbol (1-9).
      user - The name of the player (either "player 1" or "player 2").

    • containsAll

      public static boolean containsAll(int[] positions, int count, int[] winningCombination)
      Checks if the given positions contain all the positions of a winning combination.
      Parameters:
      positions - The array of positions occupied by a player.
      count - The number of occupied positions.
      winningCombination - The winning combination to check against.
      Returns:
      true if all positions in the winningCombination are found in positions; false otherwise.

    • checkEnd

      public static String checkEnd()
      Checks the current state of the game to determine if there's a winner or a tie.
      Returns:
      A string indicating the result of the game: "Player X won!", "Player O won!", "TIE!", or an empty string if the game is still ongoing.
